basics.name: Patricia Wong
basics.label: Materials and Process Engineer
basics.summary: I am a Engineer with a background in materials and processes. Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering and currently completed a Data Analytics and Visualization Boot Camp at the University of Miami expanding my skills in Python with Pandas, Matplotlib, SQL, Javascript, Tableau, and Excel. I have the ability and determination to learn effectively, solve problems creatively, and keep up with changing demands. A diligent problem solver with a love of learning, looking to start a new career.

skills.name: Software Skills
keywords: Microsoft Office (Microsoft Word, Advanced Excel, and PowerPoint)

skills.name: Electronic Packaging and Multilayer Ceramic Technology
keywords: Extensive experience in screen printing, slurry preparation and tape casting.

skills.name: Microfabrication Processing
keywords: etching  (wet and dry plasma etching and RIE).

highlights: Developed processes for multilayer ceramics manufacturing of hermetic co-fired ceramic feedthroughs.
Performed micro-fabrication processes to make flexible components for an implantable medical device (a visual prosthesis).
Completed prototype of the retinal prothesis.

Project Management including tracking and managing project schedule with Gantt charts; Patents, Grant Applications, and IP Portfolio - communicated with attorneys and team members; managed projects by coordinating customer needs with vendors and research team; Procurement and set up ISO 8 Cleanroom in the main Bionic Eye laboratory space
Trained customers how to use ceramic processing equipment - Developed SOPs and training instructions
Developed processes for multilayer ceramic manufacturing for print-based manufacturing of SSL luminaires later put into production.

work.company: Aero Maintenance Group (An Air France Industries KLM E&M Co)
highlights: Designed and supervised the construction of a test fixture for a cooling fan.
Assisted Tooling Engineering Team with daily activities.

work.company: SAIC, NASA GSDO, Kennedy Space Center
highlights: Assisted in Logistic Support Analysis review of a Recommended Spare Parts List and drawing verification with minimal oversight and direction.
Performed extensive source data research, such as cage codes, maintenance data, consumables, tech manuals and special equipment.

work.company: SAIC, NASA GSDO, Kennedy Space Center
highlights: Contributed to the Pad Operations Demonstration & Test plan, developing fabrication drawings and CAD models of various custom components for the test, including a simplified Orion hatch and its corresponding mating flange.
Assisted with building the Crew Module simulator frame; this involved hands-on work using power tools.
Integral part of various material selection trade studies.
Co-authored a PowerPoint product used at the SLS Preliminary Design Review to help illustrate GSDO concerns with future SLS evolution.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013
